title: North Carolina court orders RFK Jr.'s name to be removed just before ballots are sent
content: A North Carolina appeals court has mandated the removal of Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s name from state ballots for the presidential election after he suspended his campaign and endorsed Donald Trump. This ruling could influence the electoral dynamics in this key battleground state, just as absentee ballots were about to be mailed.
summary: A North Carolina appeals court has mandated the removal of Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s name from state ballots for the presidential election after he suspended his campaign and endorsed Donald Trump. This ruling could influence the electoral dynamics in this key battleground state, just as absentee ballots were about to be mailed.

title: Hindus for America First endorses Trump: 'He is pro-India, Harris would be destabilizing’
content: Hindus for America First has endorsed Donald Trump and will campaign against Kamala Harris in key battleground states. The group raises concerns about Harris's potential impact on Indo-US relations, while praising Trump's pro-India stance, including his efforts to strengthen defense ties with India and acknowledge Hindu persecution globally.
summary: Hindus for America First has endorsed Donald Trump and will campaign against Kamala Harris in key battleground states. The group raises concerns about Harris's potential impact on Indo-US relations, while praising Trump's pro-India stance, including his efforts to strengthen defense ties with India and acknowledge Hindu persecution globally.

title: Turkish-American woman 'shot in the head' by Israeli forces during West Bank protest
content: Aysenur Ezgi Eygi, a Turkish-American activist, was killed by gunfire during an anti-settlement protest in Beita, West Bank. Her death has triggered global condemnation and calls for a thorough investigation. The UN accuses Israeli forces of the killing, with Turkey and the US demanding accountability and transparency from Israel.
summary: Aysenur Ezgi Eygi, a Turkish-American activist, was killed by gunfire during an anti-settlement protest in Beita, West Bank. Her death has triggered global condemnation and calls for a thorough investigation. The UN accuses Israeli forces of the killing, with Turkey and the US demanding accountability and transparency from Israel.

title: Algeria votes as Tebboune eyes easy re-election
content: Algerians head to the polls for a presidential election anticipated to grant Abdelmadjid Tebboune a second term. The primary challenge is increasing voter turnout after low participation in 2019. Candidates aim at young voters, promising improved living standards and greater freedoms, amidst memories of the Hirak pro-democracy protests.
summary: Algerians head to the polls for a presidential election anticipated to grant Abdelmadjid Tebboune a second term. The primary challenge is increasing voter turnout after low participation in 2019. Candidates aim at young voters, promising improved living standards and greater freedoms, amidst memories of the Hirak pro-democracy protests.

title: Pope urges end to Papua New Guinea tribal conflicts and fair, sustainable extraction of resources
content: Pope Francis visited Papua New Guinea, urging an end to tribal violence and advocating for sustainable development of natural resources. He emphasized civic responsibility and cooperation to improve infrastructure, health, and education. Addressing Bougainville's independence issue, he called for fair resource distribution benefiting local people over multinational companies.
summary: Pope Francis visited Papua New Guinea, urging an end to tribal violence and advocating for sustainable development of natural resources. He emphasized civic responsibility and cooperation to improve infrastructure, health, and education. Addressing Bougainville's independence issue, he called for fair resource distribution benefiting local people over multinational companies.

title: US reports first bird flu case without animal exposure, sparks public health alert
content: A Missouri resident has tested positive for avian influenza without any known animal exposure, marking a first in the US. The patient, who had pre-existing conditions, was hospitalized on August 22 and later discharged after antiviral treatment. This is the 14th bird flu case reported in the country this year.
summary: A Missouri resident has tested positive for avian influenza without any known animal exposure, marking a first in the US. The patient, who had pre-existing conditions, was hospitalized on August 22 and later discharged after antiviral treatment. This is the 14th bird flu case reported in the country this year.

title: How Elon Musk is influencing Donald Trump
content: Donald Trump announced plans to appoint Elon Musk as head of a new government efficiency commission if elected president. The commission would audit the federal government and recommend reforms to reduce wasteful spending. Concerns exist about potential conflicts of interest due to Musk's business ties and existing federal contracts.
summary: Donald Trump announced plans to appoint Elon Musk as head of a new government efficiency commission if elected president. The commission would audit the federal government and recommend reforms to reduce wasteful spending. Concerns exist about potential conflicts of interest due to Musk's business ties and existing federal contracts.

title: Georgia school shooting: Suspect claimed online threats had come from hacked account
content: Colin Gray, the father of a teenager implicated in Georgia's deadliest school shooting, told investigators he had been educating his son on guns and hunting. He stated that his son's account was allegedly hacked when an online threat emerged. The incident happened at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia.
summary: Colin Gray, the father of a teenager implicated in Georgia's deadliest school shooting, told investigators he had been educating his son on guns and hunting. He stated that his son's account was allegedly hacked when an online threat emerged. The incident happened at Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia.

title: Apalachee high school shooting: Grandfather of suspect Colt Gray calls him a 'victim of his environment'
content: After the Apalachee High School shooting, suspect Colt Gray's grandfather revealed their family's troubled background. Colt faces four counts of felony murder; his father, Colin Gray, is charged with second-degree murder and other crimes. Both appeared in court as prosecutors emphasized the rare parent-child involvement in such cases.
summary: After the Apalachee High School shooting, suspect Colt Gray's grandfather revealed their family's troubled background. Colt faces four counts of felony murder; his father, Colin Gray, is charged with second-degree murder and other crimes. Both appeared in court as prosecutors emphasized the rare parent-child involvement in such cases.

title: Maryland school shooting: 15-year-old shot by fellow student during Joppatowne high bathroom dispute
content: Warren Curtis Grant, aged 15, died after being shot in a bathroom at Joppatowne High School in Maryland during a dispute with another student. The suspect, aged 16, fled the scene but was quickly apprehended. Authorities are investigating and have not yet recovered the weapon used in the incident.
summary: Warren Curtis Grant, aged 15, died after being shot in a bathroom at Joppatowne High School in Maryland during a dispute with another student. The suspect, aged 16, fled the scene but was quickly apprehended. Authorities are investigating and have not yet recovered the weapon used in the incident.

title: 'She could not have been the chosen one': Donald Trump denies sexual assault claim
content: ​​"Think of the practicality of this: I'm famous, I'm in a plane, people are coming into the plane. And I'm looking at a woman, and I grab her and start kissing her and making out with her. What are the chances of that happening?" "And frankly — I know you're going to say it's a terrible thing to say — but it couldn't have happened, it didn't happen, and she would not have been the chosen one. She would not have been the chosen one," Trump said on Jessica Leeds.
summary: ​​"Think of the practicality of this: I'm famous, I'm in a plane, people are coming into the plane. And I'm looking at a woman, and I grab her and start kissing her and making out with her. What are the chances of that happening?" "And frankly — I know you're going to say it's a terrible thing to say — but it couldn't have happened, it didn't happen, and she would not have been the chosen one. She would not have been the chosen one," Trump said on Jessica Leeds.

title: Georgia school shooter Colt Gray was bullied for 'being gay'. Father says it was difficult for him
content: Colin Gray, the father of the Georgia school shooting accused 14-year-old Colt, said his son was bullied by classmates and called names. In an interview to detectives last year, Colin Gray who gifted the gun to Colt on Christmas said it was very difficult for him to go to school and not get picked on. But why were the father-son duo interviewed by the investigators last year? The sheriff received a tip from the FBI last year that Gray had possible threated to shoot up a middle school. The threat was made on Discord.
summary: Colin Gray, the father of the Georgia school shooting accused 14-year-old Colt, said his son was bullied by classmates and called names. In an interview to detectives last year, Colin Gray who gifted the gun to Colt on Christmas said it was very difficult for him to go to school and not get picked on. But why were the father-son duo interviewed by the investigators last year? The sheriff received a tip from the FBI last year that Gray had possible threated to shoot up a middle school. The threat was made on Discord.

title: Barron Trump's photo from classroom goes viral. Is it real?
content: ​There was no claim on the photo being fake and Barron Trump was also seen in the same dress that he was seen sporting on his day one in the college. Barron Trump Wednesday attended the first class in New York University's Stern Business School, Donald Trump confirmed after Barron was seen entering the NYU Manhattan campus with his security detail.
summary: ​There was no claim on the photo being fake and Barron Trump was also seen in the same dress that he was seen sporting on his day one in the college. Barron Trump Wednesday attended the first class in New York University's Stern Business School, Donald Trump confirmed after Barron was seen entering the NYU Manhattan campus with his security detail.

title: Trump hush money sentencing delayed until after November election
content: In a huge relief for former president Donald Trump, a judge agreed Friday to postpone his sentencing in his hush money case until after the November election. Manhattan Judge Juan M. Merchan, who is also weighing a defense request to overturn the verdict on immunity grounds, delayed Trump’s sentencing until Nov 26, several weeks after the final votes are cast in the presidential election.
summary: In a huge relief for former president Donald Trump, a judge agreed Friday to postpone his sentencing in his hush money case until after the November election. Manhattan Judge Juan M. Merchan, who is also weighing a defense request to overturn the verdict on immunity grounds, delayed Trump’s sentencing until Nov 26, several weeks after the final votes are cast in the presidential election.

title: 'Abraham Lincoln's lust at first sight was....': Explosive revelation by 'Lover of Men'
content: Historians -- in the movie Lover of Men -- surmise that either Lincoln was virgin at 33 or his sexual needs before his marriage to Mary Todd were being fulfilled through men. The movie deals with four men in Abraham Lincoln's life -- William Greene, Elmer Ellsworth, David Derickson and Joshua Speed.
summary: Historians  -- in the movie Lover of Men -- surmise that either Lincoln was virgin at 33 or his sexual needs before his marriage to Mary Todd were being fulfilled through men. The movie deals with four men in Abraham Lincoln's life -- William Greene, Elmer Ellsworth, David Derickson and Joshua Speed.

title: Kamala rakes in 3x more lakshmi than Trump but he milks mileage from free media coverage
content: Kamala Harris's presidential campaign secured $361 million in August, almost three times the amount raised by Donald Trump. Overall, her campaign has gathered $615 million, supported by both elite and grassroots donors. Both campaigns are concentrating their funds on key battleground states such as Pennsylvania and Georgia to sway voters.
summary: Kamala Harris's presidential campaign secured $361 million in August, almost three times the amount raised by Donald Trump. Overall, her campaign has gathered $615 million, supported by both elite and grassroots donors. Both campaigns are concentrating their funds on key battleground states such as Pennsylvania and Georgia to sway voters.

title: William and Kate have 'justifiable fear' about Harry, Meghan: 'Anything they say could...'
content: According to an insider, there will be no reunion until Harry and Meghan apologize to their Royal Highnesses for everything they have said and there's no indication that it is possible. "It's hard to see a reconciliation. How could there be when William and Catherine have the justifiable fear that anything they say could appear in a future book or be repeated in a TV programme," an insider said.
summary: According to an insider, there will be no reunion until Harry and Meghan apologize to their Royal Highnesses for everything they have said and there's no indication that it is possible. "It's hard to see a reconciliation. How could there be when William and Catherine have the justifiable fear that anything they say could appear in a future book or be repeated in a TV programme," an insider said.

title: 'Stupidest rich people clapping for Trump droning childcare is childcare'
content: During an event at the Economic Club of New York, Donald Trump was criticized for his unclear response to a question on childcare legislation. His answer, which included 'childcare is childcare,' left many puzzled. Commentators noted both Trump's lack of clarity and the audience's reaction to his remarks. Democrat analyst question what's the use of Donald Trump's so many interactions if he just says meaningless words.
summary: During an event at the Economic Club of New York, Donald Trump was criticized for his unclear response to a question on childcare legislation. His answer, which included 'childcare is childcare,' left many puzzled. Commentators noted both Trump's lack of clarity and the audience's reaction to his remarks. Democrat analyst question what's the use of Donald Trump's so many interactions if he just says meaningless words.

title: Georgia shooting suspect Colt Gray warned of life sentence if convicted
content: Colt Gray, a 14-year-old suspect in a school shooting that killed two students and two teachers at Apalachee High School, appeared in court with his father Colin Gray. Colt is being tried as an adult. The weapon used was reportedly an AR-style rifle given by his father as a Christmas gift.
summary: Colt Gray, a 14-year-old suspect in a school shooting that killed two students and two teachers at Apalachee High School, appeared in court with his father Colin Gray. Colt is being tried as an adult. The weapon used was reportedly an AR-style rifle given by his father as a Christmas gift.

title: American woman succumbs to gunshot wounds in West Bank
content: A 26-year-old American woman was fatally shot in the head while attending a pro-Palestinian demonstration against settlement expansion in Beita, West Bank. Witnesses and Palestinian media allege that Israeli troops fired the shot. The Israeli military has not yet commented on the incident, which follows another recent shooting of an American citizen at a similar protest.
summary: A 26-year-old American woman was fatally shot in the head while attending a pro-Palestinian demonstration against settlement expansion in Beita, West Bank. Witnesses and Palestinian media allege that Israeli troops fired the shot. The Israeli military has not yet commented on the incident, which follows another recent shooting of an American citizen at a similar protest.
